children.definition: dove killer, Hsch.
dove-striker, a kind of hawk, Arist. HA 592b2.
Ammon. Diff. p.136V.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
Hsch., Phot.
glutton, Cratin. 451.
cancerous sore, canker, A. Fr. 253, E. Fr. 792, Hp. Aër. 10, D. 25.95, IG 42(1).123.135 ( Epid., iv B. C.), Gal. 7.727.
of the nature of a cancer, πάθη Plu. Suav. 2.1087e; ἕλκη Dsc. 2.78, 5.112, cf. Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.22.3, Gal. 6.750, 815.

children.label: II
children.definition: of morbid hunger, Gloss.
suffer from cancer, Hp. Epid. 4.19, 5.44: later in Act., Aq. De. 7.23, dub. in Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.20.
Pall. Febr. 7.

definition: φαγεῖν, inf. of ἔφαγον, with no pres. in use (exc. in late Gr., φαγεῖ Anon. in EN 448.16; φαγέοις in edd. of Ps.-Phoc. 157 is v. dub.), used as aor. 2 of ἐσθίω; later 1 pl. ἐφάγαμεν LXX 2 Ki. 19.42 cod.B, 3 pl. ἐφάγοσαν ib. Ge. 18.8: later fut. is φάγομαι, ib. Si. 36.23, Ev.Luc. 14.15; 2 sg. φάγεσαι LXX Ru. 2.14, Ev.Luc. 17.8; φάγῃ LXX Ge. 3.14; also φαγοῦμαι ib. 2 (v.l.); fut. φαγήσω is v. dub. in Lib. Or. 53.29:—

children.definition: eat, devour, both of men and beasts, freq. in Hom.; ἀζηχὲς φαγέμεν καὶ πιέμεν Od. 18.3, cf. 15.378, Pl. Lg. 831e; reversely, πιόντα ἢ φαγόντα Id. Prt. 314a, cf. Phd. 81b, E. Cyc. 336 (dub. l.): mostly c. acc., Il. 21.127, 24.411, etc.: c. gen., eat of a thing, Od. 9.102, 15.373; ὄρνιθος ὄρνις πῶς ἂν ἁγνεύοι φαγών; A. Supp. 226; ἀπό τινος LXX Ge. 2.16.

data.quote: ὄρνιθος ὄρνις πῶς ἂν ἁγνεύοι φαγών;

children.label: II
children.definition: eat up, devour, squander, Od. 2.76, 4.33. (Cf. παματοφαγέω and Skt. bhájati ‘apportion, ( Med.) enjoy’.)
glutton, and γαστὴρ φαγεσωρῖτις, Com.Adesp. 1183,1184.
food, victuals, Anon. ap. Suid., Demetr. Sceps. ap. Ath. 3.91d, PMag.Berol. 1.23.
an eating-festival, and φᾰγησῐπόσια, τά, an eating and drinking festival, Clearch. 62.
a lamb, either when it begins to be eatable or to eat alone, Arist. Fr. 507; written φαγηλός, φαναός in Hsch., φανυλός in Eust. 1625.38.
swallower of insults, Gloss.
glutton, Ev.Matt. 11.19, Ev.Luc. 7.34, Zen. 1.73.

sea-bream or braize, Pagrus vulgaris, Hp. lnt. 1, Eup. 38 (lyr.), Pl.Com. 56.2, Antiph. 193, Arist. HA 598a13, 601b30, Speus. ap. Ath. 7.327c, Numen.ib. 322f, BGU 1095.18 (i A. D.), Phylotim. ap. Gal. 6.726, 12.800: written φαγρώριος in Str. 17.2.4; φάγωρος in Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: whetstone, Simm. 27.

definition: φάγυλοι μαστοί, μάρσιπποι, Hsch.; cf. φαγύλιον· μαρσίππιον, Phot.

children.definition: glutton, Varro ap.Non. p.69 L., Vopisc. Aurel. 50.

children.label: II
children.definition: φαγών, όνος, ὁ, jaw, Hsch. (pl.).

definition: φαεθοντιάς, άδος, ἡ, = sq., Opp. C. 1.219.

children.definition: of Phaethon, i.e. the Sun, φ. αἴγλη, μαρμαρυγή, AP 9.782 ( Paul.Sil.), APl. 16.77 (ld.).
shine, only in part. φαέθων (exc. 3 sg. φαέθει, Hsch.), radiant, epith. of the sun, Il. 11.735, Od. 5.479, 11.16, Hes. Th. 760, S. El. 824 (lyr.), E. El. 464 (lyr.).
the sun, AP 5.273 ( Paul.Sil.), 9.137 ( Hadr.); πάννυχα καὶ φαέθοντα nights and days, S. Aj. 929 (lyr.).

children.label: b
children.definition: φαέθουσα καὶ αὐγάζουσα PMag.Par. 1.2558.
Φαέθων, ὁ, one of the light-bringing steeds of Eos, Od. 23.246.
Hes. Th. 987.
E. Hipp. 739 (lyr.), Arist. Mete. 345a15; subject of play by E.

children.label: b
children.definition: Sun, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.82, Nonn. D. 5.81.
Jupiter, Arist. Mu. 392a24, Eudox. Ars 5.14, Cic. ND 2.20.52.

definition: φαεινός, ή, όν (so always in Ep.), Aeol., Trag. (even in dialogue, E. Ph. 84, al.) and Lyr. φᾰεννός, Att. φᾱνός (q.v.):—poet. Adj.,

children.definition: shining, radiant, πῦρ Il. 5.215; σελήνη 8.555; Ἠώς Od. 4.188; ὄσσε Il. 13.3; χαλκός 12.151; κασσίτερος 23.561; ὀρείχαλκος, χρυσός, Hes. Sc. 122, 142; κρητήρ Il. 3.247, al.; δόρυ 4.496; ἀσπίς, σάκος, 3.357, 8.272; πήληξ 13.805; θώρηξ φαεινότερος πυρὸς αὐγῆς 18.610; ὅπλα E. Andr. 1146; μάστιξ Il. 10.500; θύραι Od. 6.19; of bright colours, ζωστὴρ φοίνικι φαεινός Il. 6.219, cf. 15.538; φ. πέπλος, τάπης, 5.315, 10.156; φ. πλόκαμοι bright, glossy, 14.176; εἶδος, of the stars, Sapph. 3.2; ἄστρον Pi. O. 1.6, cf. E. Cyc. 353, al.; ἔρεβος ὦ φαεννότατον ὡς ἐμοί darkness bright as the day to me, S. Aj. 395 (lyr.); of the Dawn, AP 5.227 ( Paul.Sil.).
clear, distinct, far-sounding, Pi. P. 4.283.

splendid, brilliant, ἀρεταί, θυσίαι, Id. N. 7.51, I. 5(4).30; κρηπὶς ἐλευθερίας Id. Fr. 77.—Very rare in Prose, ἐν τοῖς φαεινοῖς χρόνοις, of clear nights, Aen.Tact. 25.2; Φάεννος is pr. n. at Rhodes, Chron.Lind. B. 34.

shine, give light, freq. of the sun, ἠέλιος δʼ ἀνόρουσε . . , ἵνʼ ἀθανάτοισι φαείνοι Od. 3.2, cf. Hes. Op. 528, Call. in PSI 11.1218a7; [ ἠὼς] ἐπιχθονίοισι φ. Hes. Th. 372; also ἐν νεκύεσσι, μετʼ ἀθανάτοισι φ. Od. 12.383, 385; λαμπτῆρας τρεῖς ἵστασαν ἐν μεγάροισιν, ὄφρα φαείνοιεν 18.308; λαμπτῆρσι φαείνων giving light by . . , ib. 343:— Pass. in same sense, A.R. 2.42; appear, ib. 4.1362, Call. Ap. 9.

data.quote: ἠέλιος δʼ ἀνόρουσε . . , ἵνʼ ἀθανάτοισι φαείνοι
λαμπτῆρας τρεῖς ἵστασαν ἐν μεγάροισιν, ὄφρα φαείνοιεν

children.definition: λόγος περὶ τοῦδε φαείνει Orph. Fr. 247.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: bring to light, ὁπόσʼ ἑρπετὰ γαῖα φαείνει Nic. Th. 390.

bringing light to mortals, shining on them, ἠώς Il. 24.785, B. 12.128; Ἠέλιος Od. 10.138, 191, Hes. Th. 958; Ἀπόλλων IG 14.2524 ( Autun); Ἠριγένεια ib. 3.1326; ὄργια . . φαεσίμβροτα Δηοῦς ib. 2(2).3661 ( Eleusis, ii/iii A. D.); once in Trag., θεοῦ φαεσίμβροτοι αὐγαί E. Heracl. 750 (lyr.).
bring light, of the moon, Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 154.31.
bringing of light, illumination, Call. Dian. 11, Musae. 302.

light-bringing, λαμπάδες A. Ag. 489; Κύκλωπος ὄψις E. Cyc. 462; ἐν μακρᾷ φλογὶ φαεσφόρῳ, i. e. after many days, Id. Hel. 629 (lyr.), cf. Call. Dian. 204; Ἠώς A.R. 4.885; of Artemis, IG 14.2524 ( Autun). Cf. φωσφόρος.
disease in horses, Hippiatr. 130.119 (acc. sg. written φαζάναν cod.B, φαζάνην cod. M).
disease contracted in the Red Sea, Hsch.

definition: Φαίαξ, ᾱκος, Ion. Φαίηξ, ηκος, ὁ,

children.definition: Phaeacian, Od. 5.35, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: conduits or sewers ( φαίᾱκες or φαιᾱκοί), D.S. 11.25.

definition: φαίδιμος, ον, also α, ον Pi. P. 4.28, N. 1.68 (not used by Hom. in fem.): ( φαιδρός):—

children.definition: shining, radiant, glistening, esp. of menʼs limbs, φ. ὦμος Od. 11.128, Pi. O. 1.27; γυῖα Il. 6.27, Hes. Th. 492; κόμα Pi. N. 1.68; πρόσοψις Id. P. 4.28 (s. v. l.); sleek, glossy, ἵπποι Id. O. 6.14.

famous, glorious, φαίδιμʼ Ἀχιλλεῦ Il. 9.434; φαίδιμʼ Ὀδυσσεῦ Od. 10.251; φαίδιμος Ἕκτωρ, αἴας, Il. 4.505, 5.617, etc.—Used by Trag. only in Ep. phrases, φαίδιμʼ Ἀχιλλεῦ A. Fr. 131 (anap., ap. Ar. Ra. 992); ἀμφὶ φ. ὤμοις S. Fr. 453; so φ. βραχίονες Achae. 4.
in bright attire, Agath. 5.15.
with bright, joyous mind, light-hearted, A. Ag. 1229 (s. v. l.).
beam with joy, X. Cyr. 2.2.16.

bright, beaming, φάος Pi. Fr. 109; ἁλίου σέλας A. Eu. 926 (lyr.); σελήνη Id. Ag. 298; τράπεζαι Cratin. 301 (troch.); κρατήρ Alex. 119.1; of sparkling water, λευκῶν φαιδροτέρην λιβάδων (of a woman), AP 7.218 ( Antip. Sid.); ἀήρ Poll. 9.20.

beaming with joy, bright, cheerful (opp. στυγνός, X. An. 2.6.11), φ. πρόσωπον Sol. 42.3, S. El. 1297, etc.; φ . . . ὄμμασι δέξασθε . . βασιλέα A. Ag. 520; φ. φρενὶ δέξασθαι Id. Ch. 565; φ. κάρα S. El. 1310; ὄμμα φ. ὡς εἶδον τέκνων E. Med. 1043; φαιδροῖς ὠσίν, of a horse pricking his ears, Ar. Pax 156 (anap.); of persons, of glad countenance, cheerful, X. Cyr. 3.3.59, Gal. 6.186, 16.615 ( Comp.), etc.; φαιδρὸς λάμποντι μετώπῳ Ar. Eq. 550 (anap.); ὄμμασι καὶ σχήμασι καὶ βαδίσματι φαιδρός X. Ap. 27; κυνὲς ἀπὸ τῶν προσώπων φ. Id. Cyn. 4.2; ἐπί τινι φ. glad at a thing, D. 18.323. Adv. -δρῶς joyously, cheerily, φ. βιοτεύων X. Cyr. 4.6.6, cf. 4.2.11; neut. pl. φαιδρά as Adv., φ. γοῦν ἀπʼ ὀμμάτων σαίνει με with happy smile, S. OC 319, cf. Fr. 766 (anap.).

data.quote: ὄμμασι καὶ σχήμασι καὶ βαδίσματι φαιδρός
φ. γοῦν ἀπʼ ὀμμάτων σαίνει με

children.label: II
children.definition: Φαῖδρος: fem. Φαίδρα, Ion. Φαίδρη, parox. (Cf. Lith. giẽdras ‘fair, clear (weather, sky)ʼ.)
brightness, brilliance, ὀφθαλμῶν Poll. 6.199; λίθων Lib. Or. 11.89, cf. 221.
joyousness, Isoc. 15.133, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.595d.
cleanser, Poll. 7.37.

children.label: II
children.definition: φαιδρυνταί, οἱ, descendants of Phidias, who had charge of the statue of Zeus at Elis, Paus. 5.14.5, Inscr.Olymp. 466.5, cf. AB 314: written φαιδυνταί in Inscrr., Sammelb. 2536 ( Naucratis), IG 2(2).1078.16, al., IGRom. 4.1680.
of or for cleaning, Poll. 7.37.

definition: φαιδρύντρια, ἡ, fem. of φαιδρυντής, σπαργάνων φ.

children.definition: washer of baby-linen, A. Ch. 759.

make bright, cleanse (coupled with ἀποπλύνειν καὶ διαπλύνειν by Poll. 7.40), τινὰ λουτροῖσι φ. A. Ag. 1109 (lyr.); θεαὶ μορφὰν ἐφαίδρυναν gave me a bright form, says Helen, E. Hel. 678 (lyr.); φ. χρόα Call. Jov. 32; δέμας, εἵματα, A.R. 3.1043, 4.671; στεφανοῦντα καὶ φαιδρύνοντα τὸν Ἑρμῆν καὶ τὴν Ἑκάτην Porph. Abst. 2.16; χεῖρας AP 5.227 ( Paul.Sil.); τῇ γλώττῃ τὸ πρόσωπον Ael. NA 3.21; [ Ἥλιος] κοσμῶν καὶ φαιδρύνων Jul. Or. 4.142a:— Med., λουτρῷ χρόα φαιδρύνεσθαι to wash oneʼs skin clean, Hes. Op. 753, cf. Mosch. 2.31.

data.quote: στεφανοῦντα καὶ φαιδρύνοντα τὸν Ἑρμῆν καὶ τὴν Ἑκάτην

children.label: II
children.definition: cheer, A. Ag. 1120:— Med., τὸν ἑαυτοῦ βίον φαιδρύνασθαι Pl. Lg. 718b:— Pass., beam or brighten up with joy, X. Cyr. 5.5.37; ἐπί τινι at a thing, Callistr. Stat. 9; τὼ ὀφθαλμώ Poll. 6.199.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., become more glaring, of a fever, ἀεὶ μᾶλλον ἐφαιδρύνετο Gal. 14.653.
with bright, joyous look, of a young lion (cf. χαροπός), A. Ag. 725 (lyr.); ὄμμα φ. E. Or. 894.
Hsch.
shoe, worn by Athenian gymnasiarchs, Egyptian priests, and others, AP 6.254 ( Myrin.).

definition: φαικάσιον [ᾰ], τό, = foreg., Eratosth. 9, Wilcken Chr. 20 iii 7 (ii A. D.), App. BC 5.11, Plu. Ant. 33, etc.

children.definition: = Lat. faecula, PHolm. 16.2 ( φακλαν Pap.); cf. φέκλη, σφέκλη.
S. Fr. 1107. Adv. -κῶς Hsch.

definition: φαιλόνη, ἡ, and φελόνη, ἡ, = sq., Gloss.

children.definition: 2 Ep.Ti. 4.13 (wrongly expld. by γλωσσόκομον, εἰλητάριον μεμβράϊνον, Hsch.); written φελόνης in PFay. 347 (ii A. D.), v.l. in 2 Ep.Ti. l.c.:— Dim. φαιλόνιον POxy. 933.30 (ii A. D.); written φ[ε]λόνιον in PGen. 80.14 (iv A. D.).
at ball, Antiph. 283, Juba 81, Ath. 1.14f, Poll. 9.105: written φενίνδα in Com.Adesp. 711.

definition: φαινίς, ίδος, ἡ, Laced. for ἀνεμώνη, Sosib. ap. Sch. Theoc. 5.92.

children.definition: = Lat. paenula, thick upper garment, cloak, Rhinth. 7, cf. φαινόλα· τὸ ὕφασμα, Hsch.; φαίνουλα Edict.Diocl. 19.51 (Megalop.), παίνουλα ib. 52, πένουλα ib. 51 (Megar.):—but usu. φαινόλης, ου, ὁ, Arr. Epict. 4.8.34, Ath. 3.97e, Artem. 2.3, Poll. 7.61, POxy. 736.4 (i A. D.).
light-bringing, light-giving, ἠώς h.Cer. 51, Mosch. 4.121; αὔως Sapph. 95.
apparently, opp. ὡς ἀληθῶς, Procl. in Prm. p.499 S.; opp. ἀφανῶς, ib.p.618 S.; φ. καὶ εἰδωλικῶς Id. in R. 1.77 K.
showing the thigh, with bare thigh, Ibyc. 61; cf. φανόμηρις.
with shining feet, Theognost. Can. 12.
show oneʼs face, put in an appearance, coined by Cic. Att. 7.21.1:—hence φαινο-προσωπητέον, one must put in an appearance, ib. 14.22.2.
foeniculum, = μάραθρον, Et.Gud. s.h.v.
bright-eyed, conspicuous, ἀέλιον Hymn.Is. 31, cf. Man. 4.239: in Il. only as pr.n.

definition: φαίνω, Od. 7.102, etc., Ep. also φαείνω (q. v.):— fut. φᾰνῶ, A. Fr. 304.5, Ar. Ach. 827, etc. ( φᾱνῶ acc. to A.D. Adv. 187.26, but φᾱνῶ, Ar. Eq. 300, and ἀναφᾱνῶ, E. Ba. 528, are dub.); Ion. φᾰνέω ( ἀπο-) Hp. Steril. 213, opt. φᾰνοίην S. Aj. 313 (cod. rec., rightly): aor. 1 ἔφηνα Il. 2.318, Hdt. 1.95, etc.; Dor. ἔφᾱνα Pi. I. 4(3).2, IG 42(1).123.28 ( Epid., iv B.C.), also later Att., subj., ἀπο-φάνῃ dub. l. in IG 2(2).1631.379 ( = 2.811c133); φάνῃς Philem. 233 ( ἐκ-φάνῃς Men. Mon. 418 = Chares Iamb. 4b20); so in late Prose, ( ἐξ-) Ael. VH 12.33, ( ἐπι-) Ev.Luc. 1.79, ( ἀνα-) Act.Ap. 21.3; Ep. iter. φάνεσκε (intr.) Il. 11.64, al., Hes. Fr. 14.3: pf. πέφαγκα Ps.-Callisth. 2.10, ( ἀπο-) Din. 1.15, al.: intr. pf. πέφηνα (v. infr. A.III.2), Dor. 3 pl. ἐκ-πεφάναντι Sophr. 83; plpf. ἐπεφήνειν D.C. 46.10:— Med., fut. inf. φᾰνεῖσθαι Od. 12.230, Ion. φᾰνέομαι Hdt. 3.35; opt. φανοῖσθε Lys. 26.10 (nisi leg. φανεῖσθε); the forms φανῆσθον and Dor. imper. φάνευ are corrupt in Pl. Erx. 399e, Teles p.58 H. (leg. φαίνευ): aor. 1 ἐφηνάμην (trans.) S. Ph. 944, ( ἀπ-) Hdt. 7.52, etc.:— Pass., Ion. impf. φαινέσκετο Od. 13.194: fut. φᾰνήσομαι Hdt. 8.108, Sicilian Dor. ( inf.) φᾰνήσειν (fort. -ησεῖν) Archim. A ren. 4.20; Ep. fut. πεφήσεται Il. 17.155: aor. 1 ἐφάνθην A. Pers. 263 (lyr.), S. OT 525, etc.:rare in Prose, X. HG 6.4.11, D. 58.13, ( ἀπο-) IG 1(2).10.35, D. 19.44; Ep. 3 sg. φαάνθη Il. 17.650, 3 pl. φάανθεν 1.200: aor. 2 ἐφάνην [ᾰ], Ep. φάνην Il. 1.477, etc.; Ep. 3 pl. φάνεν Od. 18.68; Ep. subj. φανήῃ Il. 19.375; Ep. inf. φανήμεναι 9.240: pf. πέφασμαι S. OC 1543, 3 sg. πέφανται Il. 2.122, 16.207, Pi. P. 5.115, A. Ag. 374 (lyr.); πέφᾰται in B. 9.52, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.28.19 belongs either to φαίνω in sense A. I.5, or to φημί; inf. πεφάνθαι Pl. Euthd. 294a, etc.; part. πεφασμένος Il. 14.127, Thgn. 227, A. Pr. 843, S. OC 1122, Pl. Phdr. 245e, etc.; 3 pl. plpf. ἐπέφαντο Hes. Sc. 166.

children.label: A
children.definition: Act., bring to light, cause to appear, in physical sense, τέρας τινὶ φ. make a sign appear to one, Il. 2.324, cf. Od. 3.173, etc.; σήματα φαίνων Il. 2.353; γένυσι φ. ὀπώραν Pi. N. 5.6; δύο μορφὰς φ. A. Fr. 304.5; τὸν αὐχένα Hdt. 2.132; ἔφηνʼ ἄφαντον φῶς, i.e. fire, S. Ph. 297; λαμπάδας Ar. Ra. 1524 (anap.); φ. θησαυρόν E. El. 565; φ. μηρούς, ἐπιγουνίδα, show by baring, i.e. uncover . . , Od. 18.67, 74; φαίνοισα πρόσωπον ἀλάθεια Pi. N. 5.17; reflect an image in water, τὰ δέ νιν καλὰ κύματα φαίνει Theoc. 6.11:— Med., τὰ τόξα . . τοῖσιν Ἀργείοισι φήνασθαι θέλει exhibit them as his own, S. Ph. 944.

data.quote: τὰ δέ νιν καλὰ κύματα φαίνει

children.label: b
children.definition: make known, reveal, disclose, ἐς τὸ φῶς φανεῖ κακά Id. OT 1229; κακῶν ἔκλυσιν E. IT 898 (lyr., prob.); τὸν μιαρὸν τῷ χρόνῳ ἀποδόντες φῆναι Antipho 4.4.11; ὁδόν τινι Od. 12.334; τὰ ὀνείρατα καὶ τὸν πόρον X. An. 4.3.13, cf. Cyr. 6.4.13, S. OT 725; τοῖς πολεμίοις σύνθημα Din. 3.10, etc.; φανεῖ . . κωκύματα wailings will show forth [the truth of what I say], S. Ant. 1078: with a predic. added, ἡμᾶς σὺ δειλοὺς φανεῖς wilt make us appear . . , Id. Aj. 1362; τὸν Λαΐου φόνον φανεῖ δικαίως ὀρθόν Id. OT 853.

data.quote: τὸν μιαρὸν τῷ χρόνῳ ἀποδόντες φῆναι
τὸν Λαΐου φόνον φανεῖ δικαίως ὀρθόν

children.label: c
children.definition: γόνον Ἑλένῃ φ. show her a child, i.e. grant her to bear one, Od. 4.12; φ. παράκοιτίν τινι show ( i.e. give) one a wife, 15.26.
make it clear to the ear, make it ring clear, ἀοιδὴν φαίνειν 8.499; σάλπιγξ . . ὑπέρτονον γήρυμα φαινέτω στρατῷ A. Eu. 569.
show forth, display in action, ἀρετήν Od. 8.237; ἀεικείας 20.309; βίην Hes. Th. 689; εὐμαχανίαν Pi. I. 4(3).2; εὔνοιαν Hdt. 3.36; ὕβριν ib. 127; ὀργάς A. Ch. 326 (lyr.).

children.label: b
children.definition: set forth, expound, νοήματα Il. 18.295; λόγον Hdt. 1.116; τριφασίας λόγων ὁδούς Id. 1.95; but τὰ λαμπρὰ . . φ. ἔπη make them good, S. OC 721.

inform against one, denounce, φανῶ σε ( σε φανῶ codd.) τοῖς πρυτάνεσι Ar. Eq. 300 (lyr.), cf. Ach. 824, S. Ant. 325: denounce a thing as contraband, Ar. Ach. 542, 819, al.; φαίνειν πλοῖον D. 58.9; τὰ φανθέντα articles denounced as contraband, ib. 13: abs., give information, ὁ φήνας ἢ ὁ γραψάμενος IG 1(2).45.3, cf. 4.24, Isoc. 18.20, X. Cyr. 1.2.14, Phld. Rh. 2.207 S., etc.

φαίνειν φρουράν, call up a levy, at Sparta, X. HG 3.2.23, al.; also φ. θυσίαν proclaim, order a sacrifice, Philod.Scarph. 112:— Pass., πέφαται θνατοῖσι νίκας ὕστερον εὐφροσύνα has been ordained, B. 9.52.

children.label: II
children.definition: give light, shine, φαίνοντες νύκτας . . δαιτυμόνεσσι Od. 7.102, cf. 19.25; of the sun, moon, etc., φ. τινί Ar. Nu. 586 (troch.); εἰς ἅπαντα φ. τὸν οὐρανόν Pl. Ti. 39b; ἀλλά, σελάνα, φαῖνε καλόν Theoc. 2.11; οἱ λύχνοι φ. ἧττον Thphr. Ign. 11; cf. φάω: so ἦρι μὲν φαίνοντι in spring when it shines forth, A. Fr. 304.4 codd. (leg. φανέντι); of the Dioscuri shining in mid-air, E. El. 1234 (anap.): metaph., ἀγανὴ φαίνουσʼ ἐλπίς soft shining hope, A. Ag. 101 (anap., dub.).

children.label: b
children.definition: Φαίνων, οντος, ὁ, the planet Saturn, Arist. Mu. 392a23, Cic. ND 2.20.52, etc.; Φ. ὁ τοῦ Ἡλίου Eudox. Ars 5.19; acc. -ωνα Placit. 2.15.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: Ep. iter. φάνεσκε appeared, μετὰ πρώτοισι φάνεσκε Il. 11.64; ὑπένερθε δὲ γαῖα φάνεσκε Od. 12.242, cf. 11.587, Hes. Fr. 14.3.
pf. 2 πέφηνα is also used intr., S. OC 328, etc.; less freq. in Prose, Hdt. 9.120, D. 3.22, Plb. 9.13.8.

children.label: B
children.definition: Pass., come to light, appear, φάνεν δέ οἱ εὐρέες ὦμοι, being stripped bare, Od. 18.68, cf. Il. 22.324, Od. 19.39: freq. of fire, shine brightly, πυρὰ φαίνετο Ἰλιόθι πρό Il. 8.561; ἕκαθεν δέ τε φαίνεται αὐγή 2.456; δεινὼ δέ οἱ ὄσσε φάανθεν shone like fire, Il. 1.200: freq. of the rising of heavenly bodies, ἄστρα φαεινὴν ἀμφὶ σελήνην φαίνετʼ ἀριπρεπέα 8.556, cf. Hes. Op. 598; of the first gleam of daybreak, ἦμος δʼ ἠριγένεια φάνη ῥοδοδάκτυλος Ἠώς Il. 1.477, Od. 2.1, al.; ἅμʼ ἠοῖ φαινομένηφι at break of day, Il. 9.618, cf. Od. 4.407, al.; ἀκτὶς ἀελίου, τὸ κάλλιστον . . φανὲν . . τῶν προτέρων φάος, ἐφάνθης ποτʼ S. Ant. 100 (lyr.): of a rising wind, οὐδέ ποτʼ οὖροι πνείοντες φαίνονθʼ ἁλιαέες Od. 4.361; of a vapour, ἐκ νεφέων ἐρεβεννὴ φ. ἀήρ Il. 5.864.

data.quote: ἄστρα φαεινὴν ἀμφὶ σελήνην φαίνετʼ ἀριπρεπέα
ἦμος δʼ ἠριγένεια φάνη ῥοδοδάκτυλος Ἠώς
ἀκτὶς ἀελίου, τὸ κάλλιστον . . φανὲν . . τῶν προτέρων φάος, ἐφάνθης ποτʼ
οὐδέ ποτʼ οὖροι πνείοντες φαίνονθʼ ἁλιαέες

children.definition: οἴῳ φαινομένη appearing to him alone, Il. 1.198, cf. Od. 15.517, etc.; ἐφάνη λὶς εἰς ὁδόν Il. 15.275; οὗπερ κἀφάνης where thou didst first appear, S. OC 77; χρόνιος φανείς Id. Ph. 1446 (anap.); ὁδόν φανῆναι a pregnant expression for ἐλθεῖν ὁδὸν ὥστε φανῆναι, Id. El. 1274 (lyr.); κέλευθον φανείς Aj. 878 (lyr.); πόθεν φαίνῃ; whence come you? Pl. Prt. 309a, X. Mem. 2.8.1; οὐδαμοῦ φ. is nowhere to be seen, Id. An. 1.10.16.

children.label: b
children.definition: come into being, φανεὶς δύστηνος born to misery, S. OC 974, cf. 1225 (lyr.); become, ἐκ βασιλέως ἰδιώτην φανῆναι X. An. 7.7.28; δυοῖν ἐφάνη τριήραρχος D. 18.104; to be made out, δοῦλος λόγοισιν . . φανείς S. Aj. 1020, cf. 1241.

come about, τέλος οὔ πώ τι πέφανται Il. 2.122; φάνη βιότοιο τελευτή 7.104; ἔργον, ἄεθλον, etc., 16.207, Od. 21.106, etc.; τὸ φανθέν S. Tr. 743; of sayings, to be set forth, λόγος ἀρχαῖος φανείς ib. 1, cf. OT 474 (lyr.), 848.

children.label: II
children.definition: appear to be so and so, c. inf., δμῳάων ἥ τίς τοι ἀρίστη φαίνεται εἶναι Od. 15.25, cf. 11.336; οὐ γάρ σφιν ἐφαίνετο κέρδιον εἶναι 14.355; τοῦτό μοι θειότατον φαίνεται γενέσθαι Hdt. 7.137; εὖ σὺ λέγειν φαίνει Ar. Nu. 403 (anap.), cf. A. Pr. 319, etc.: freq. with inf. omitted, οὗ καὶ πρόσθεν ἀρίστη φαίνετο βουλή Il. 9.94, cf. 2.5; ὅς τις φαίνηται ἄριστος Od. 14.106; σμερδαλέος αὐτῇσι φάνη 6.137; ἕρμαιον ἂν ἐφάνη Pl. R. 368d, etc.: but in Hdt., etc., also c. part., to be manifest: thus, ἐμοὶ σὺ πλουτέειν μέγα φαίνεαι you appear to me to be very rich, Hdt. 1.32; but εὔνοος ἐφαίνετο ἐών he was manifestly well-inclined, Id. 7.173, cf. 175, Th. 1.2; οὐκ ἄκαιρα φαίνεται λέγειν he appears to be speaking . . , A. Pr. 1036; but φανέονται λέγοντες οὐδέν it will be manifest that they talk nonsense, Hdt. 3.35; φαίνομαι δύο καθορᾶν εἴδη Pl. Sph. 235d; but οὐκ ἂν φανεῖμεν πήματʼ ἔρξαντες A. Pers. 786; πλαγκτὸς οὖσʼ ἐφαινόμην Id. Ag. 593, cf. Hdt. 9.89, E. Andr. 343; ἐφάνησαν πεπονθότες Pl. Ap. 22c: with part. omitted, πέφανται ἁρματηλάτας σοφός (sc. ὤν) Pi. P. 5.115, cf. N. 6.14; κρατηθεὶς ἡμερώτερος φανεῖ A. Ag. 1632; Κᾶρες ἐφάνησαν (sc. ὄντες) they were seen to be Carians, Th. 1.8; τί φαίνομαι (sc. ὤν) δῆτʼ; what do I look like? E. Ba. 925; ὡς ἀγαθοὶ . . ἐφάνησαν Pl. R. 408a: hence φαίνεσθαι, opp. εἶναι, εἶναι μὲν ὅσπερ εἰμί, φαίνεσθαι δὲ μή E. Fr. 698 (ap. Ar. Ach. 441); στρατηγὸς ἀγαθὸς μὴ ὢν φαίνεσθαι X. Mem. 1.7.3; ὀλίγοι καὶ ὄντες καὶ φαινόμενοι Id. HG 6.5.28.

data.quote: δμῳάων ἥ τίς τοι ἀρίστη φαίνεται εἶναι
οὐ γάρ σφιν ἐφαίνετο κέρδιον εἶναι
οὗ καὶ πρόσθεν ἀρίστη φαίνετο βουλή
εἶναι, εἶναι μὲν ὅσπερ εἰμί, φαίνεσθαι δὲ μή

children.definition: φαίνομαι (abs.) is sts. used of what appears to the senses, φαίνεται δʼ οὐδὲν is observed, Arist. Ph. 204b35, cf. Cael. 312b30; φ. κατὰ τὴν αἴσθησιν Id. GA 716a31: sts. of what is mentally manifest, Id. EN 1175a29; to be evident, Id. APr. 24b24: esp. appear to the imagination (cf. φαντασία 2), Pl. Sph. 264b; φ. καὶ μύουσιν ὁράματα Arist. de An. 428a16; φ. δέ τι . . οἷον τὰ ἐν τοῖς ὕπνοις ib. a7: distd. from αἰσθάνεσθαι and δοξάζειν, ib. b1: esp. in part. φαινόμενος, η, ον:

children.label: a
children.definition: appearing in sense experience, τὰ φ. κατὰ τὴν αἴσθησιν Id. Cael. 303a22, al.; εἴτε τὰ δοκοῦντα πάντα ἐστὶν ἀληθῆ καὶ τὰ φ. Id. Metaph. 1009a8, cf. de An. 404a29 (sg.); τὰ φ. sense-data, Id. PA 639b8, Epicur. Ep. 1pp. 9,10 U., al.: Astron., τὰ φ. = celestial phenomena, title of a work by Eudoxus, versified by Aratus, Hipparch. 1.1.8, cf. Arist. Cael. 293b27; πρός τινας δόξας αὑτῶν τὰ φ. προσέλκοντες ib. 293a26: generally, τὸ μὴ ἐκ φαινομένων τὸ βλεπόμενον γεγονέναι Ep.Hebr. 11.3.

data.quote: εἴτε τὰ δοκοῦντα πάντα ἐστὶν ἀληθῆ καὶ τὰ φ.
τὸ μὴ ἐκ φαινομένων τὸ βλεπόμενον γεγονέναι

children.label: b
children.definition: apparent, opp. ὄντα τῇ ἀληθείᾳ, Pl. R. 596e, cf. Arist. Top. 100b24, EN 1113a24; τὰ οὖν ἐμοὶ φαινόμενα οὕτω φαίνεται Pl. R. 517b; [ νοῦς] τῶν φ. θειότατον Arist. Metaph. 1074b16; τὸ φ. εἰπεῖν to express oneʼs opinion, Plu. Symp. 2.158c: hence, specious, fallacious, φ. ἐνθυμήματα, opp. ὄντα, Arist. Rh. 1402a28.

data.quote: τὰ οὖν ἐμοὶ φαινόμενα οὕτω φαίνεται

children.label: c
children.definition: τὰ φ. what is to be seen, show, Lib. Or. 30.28.
φαίνεται, yes, Prt. 332e, R. 333c, al.; ὥς γέ μοι φ. Prt. 324d, cf. R. 383a, al.: [ τοῦτο] φῂς εἶναι; Answ. φαίνομαι (sc. λέγειν) X. Mem. 4.2.20.

children.label: b
children.definition: inf., it seems good, ἐάν σοι φαίνηται Wilcken Chr. 304.11 (iii B.C.), cf. PCair.Zen. 44.7, 16 (iii B.C.), etc.; ὁπότε αὐτῷ φανείη στρατιὰν ἐξάγειν D.H. 2.14, cf. 4.85.
δοκέω, εἰ δὴ κακός τε φ. δοκῶ τέ σοι E. Hipp. 1071; δοκοῖμεν ἂν . . χείρους φαίνεσθαι Th. 1.122, cf. Pl. Phdr. 269d, Erx. 399c, X. Mem. 2.1.22.

data.quote: δοκέω, εἰ δὴ κακός τε φ. δοκῶ τέ σοι

children.definition: οὐδαμοῦ φαίνεσθαι ‘to be nowhere’, metaph. from racing, Pl. Phd. 72c, cf. Grg. 456b, D. 18.310.

children.label: III
children.definition: τὰ φανθέντα, v. supr. A. I.4.

definition: Φαίνων, ὁ, v. foreg. A ΙΙ. b.
φαινῶπις, ιδος, ἡ, pecul. fem. of φαῖνοψ, Man. 4.177.

children.definition: grey, of any colour mixed of black and white, Pl. Ti. 68c, cf. Arist. Cat. 12a18, Top. 106b6, al.: opp. to both μέλας and λευκός, in a negative sense, Pl. R. 585a; φ. ἄρτοι, opp. to λευκοί, Alex. 120; τὸ ξανθὸν ἢ φ. Jul. Or. 4.138d; of mourning, φ. ἱμάτια Plb. 30.4.5; ἀποθέσθαι τὰ φ. Id. 15.25.11; φ. ἐσθής SIG 1219.5 ( Gambreion, iii B.C.)), D.H. 5.17, D.C. 49.12, al.; ἰώδης καὶ φ. χολή ( καλοῦσι δʼ αὐτὴν ἰσατώδη) Gal. 15.35; dark-complexioned, P.Strassb. 79.2 (i B.C.).
harsh, Arist. Top. 106b7, Aud. 802a2, Poll. 2.117, S.E. M. 6.41.

children.label: II
children.definition: φαιά, ἡ, name of a plaster, Androm. ap. Gal. 13.906, etc. (Cf. Lith. gaĩsas ‘reflected light of a blazing fire’.)
sable-tailed, Lyc. 334.
dark-robed, A. Ch. 1049 (where the second syll. is apparently long metri causa).

definition: φαιρίδδω, Lacon. or Boeot. for σφαιρίζω, and φαιρωτήρ for σφαιρωτήρ, Hsch.
φακαρίς, ίδος, ἡ, prob. an error for φαλᾱρίς, Gloss.

children.definition: Suid. s.v. Διοσκουρίδης.
shop where lentil soup is sold, BGU 9i8 (iii A. D.).

bundle, faggot, φρυγάνων, ῥάβδων, Hdt. 4.62, 67; ξύλων E. Cyc. 242; δονάκων Opp. H. 4.419 ( σφακέλους codd.); ὕλης Th. 2.77; οἱ φ. τῶν ῥάβδων, = Lat. fasces, D.C. 53.1; also written φάκελλος Arist. Metaph. 1016a1 (but φάκελος codd. EJ and Alex.Aphr. and so all codd. in 1042b17), Aen.Tact. 33.1, D.H. 7.11, J. AJ 5.7.4 (v.l. φακέλους), Polyaen. 7.6.9, but the form φάκελος is corroborated by Phld. Rh. 1.74 S., Edict.Diocl. 32.26, and required by the metre in E. and Opp. ll.cc.; distd. from σφάκελος by Ptol.Asc.p.406 H.; cf. κομποφακελορρήμων.

children.label: II
children.definition: Phot., Suid.
one who boils lentil soup, PPetr. cited in PHib. 1.112.77 note (iii B.C.), PPar. 67.16 ( Ptol.), PBouriant 13.1 (i A. D.), PLond. 3.944.2 (iii A. D.).

definition: φακῆ, ῆς, ἡ, contr. for φακέα, a form found in Epich. 33, ridiculed by Euphro 3:—

children.definition: dish of lentils ( φακοί), lentil-soup, Ar. Eq. 1007, V. 811, al., Diocl. Fr. 141, PHib. 1.112.77 (iii B. C.), etc.; in parodies of Trag.Adesp. 89,92 ap. Ath. 4.156f: prov. τοὐπὶ τῇ φ. μύρον ‘pearls before swine’, Sopat. 14, Clearch. 53, Cic. Att. 1.19.2; title of Menippean satire by Varro; ὅταν φακῆν ἕψητε μὴ ʼπιχεῖν μύρον Stratt. 45.

data.quote: ὅταν φακῆν ἕψητε μὴ ʼπιχεῖν μύρον

children.definition: the middle finger, PLond. 1821.297.
PSI 4.402 (iii B. C.).

face-cloth, turban, towel, Dura 4 100 (iii A. D.), PTeb. 406.18 (iii A. D.), Edict.Diocl. 26.99, 114, 29.38, Lyd. Mag. 1.32; also written φακι-άριον, τό, POxy. 114.7 (ii/iii A. D.), etc., and πακιάλιον, φακιόλιον (qq.v.).
lentil-seller, BGU 9iv20, 1087 ii13, v15 (iii A. D.).
made of lentils, ἄρτος Sopat. 1; φάκινον δεῖ ποιεῖν i.e. of the consistency of φακῆ, Zos.Alch. p.172 B.
Ar. Pl. 729; written φακιώλιον Stud.Pal. 20.245.23 (vi A. D.).
decoction of lentils, used as an emetic, Hp. Morb. 2.43.
lentiform, Arist. Cael. 287a20, Str. 17.1.34, Dsc. 4.139, Gal. 10.448; esp. φ. χιτών, of the capsule of the lens of the eye, Ruf. Onom. 153.

children.label: II
children.definition: φακοειδές, τό, = ἔμπετρον Dsc. 4.179.
compound of lentils and honey, as a desiccative application, Paul.Aeg. 6.22 (v.l. φαβόμελι).
a decoction of lentils and barley, Gal. 6.527,540.
lentil-shop, PTeb. 402.38 (ii A. D.).

definition: φακός, ὁ ( φακόν, τό, Pap. in Philol. 80.340 (s. v.l.)),

children.definition: lentil, Ervum Lens, and its fruit, Solon 38.3, Hdt. 4.17, IG 1(2).334.7, Thphr. HP 8.1.4, Diocl. Fr. 117, etc.; φακὸν ἕψειν Theoc. 10.54; ἕψημα φακοῦ LXX Ge. 25.34; ἀφέψημα φακοῦ Sor. 1.121.

children.label: b
children.definition: lentil-soup, Pherecr. 67.3, Amphis 40, Gal. 6.770, Vict.Att. 7.
φ. ὁ ἐπὶ τῶν τελμάτων, duckweed, Lemna minor, Dsc. 1.12, 4.87.

children.label: II
children.definition: anything shaped like lentils:
hot-water bottle, POxy. 1088.46 (i A. D.); φ. ὀστράκινος Hp. Nat.Mul. 34; πυρίη φακῶν τῶν κεραμήων Aret. CA 2.5; φ. τοῦ ἐλαίου oil-flask, LXX 1 Ki. 10.1; τοῦ ὕδατος ib. 26.11.
spot on the body, mole, birthmark, PPetr. 3p.2, al. (iii B. C.), Dsc. 1.13, 5.118, Plu. Vind. 2.563a, Praec. 800e, Gal. 11.845, etc.
ornament on beds, Theodor.Hierap. ap. Ath. 10.413b. (Cf. Albanian ba θε ‘Vicia Faba’.)
with moles or freckles on the face, Gloss.
from Φακοῦσσαι (later Φακοῦσαι) in Egypt, ἀφρός Aglaïas 20 (i.e. νίτρον, which was called φακούσιον acc. to Sch. l.c.).
Dim. of πάκτων, PLond. 5.1904.6 (v/vi A. D.).
lentil-coloured, Hp. Epid. 3.14; of the kidneys, Ruf. Anat. 51.
freckled, Diocl. Fr. 179.
a being freckled, Heph.Astr. 1.1 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: discoloration of the white of the eye, Gal. 14.768.

lentil-shaped, of hot-water bottles, Archig. ap. Aët. 9.28, Orib. Fr. 116; provided with a lenticular terminal guard, [ ἐκκοπεύς] Gal. 10.449; provided with a lenticular screw-thread, κοχλίας Hero Mech. 2.5 (ii p.286 Schmidt).
commander of a φαλαγγαρχία I, Arr. Tact. 10.6, Ascl. Tact. 2.10, Ael. Tact. 9.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: commander of a φαλαγγαρχία II, Ascl. Tact. 9, Ael. Tact. 23.
corps of 4096 men, Ascl. Tact. 2.10, Ael. Tact. 9.8, Arr. Tact. 10.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: contingent of 64 elephants, Ascl. Tact. 9 (cf. Ael. Tact. 23).
in phalanxes, Il. 15.360, Plb. 3.115.12, Polyaen. 7.44.2, Onos. 21.6.
to be venomous, prob. l. in Hsch. for φαλαγγῶσα.
bitten by a venomous spider, Dsc. 4.52, 115, Gal. 14.180.
venomous spider, esp. Lathrodectus or malmignatte, Pl. Euthd. 290a, X. Mem. 1.3.12, Thphr. HP 8.10.1, Diocl. Fr. 145; distd. from ἀράχνιον, Arist. HA 622b28, cf. 555b12.

children.label: II
children.definition: spider-wort, Lloydia graeca, a herb, said to cure this spiderʼs bite, Dsc. 3.108.

children.label: III
children.definition: log or roller put under a ship, Hsch., Eust. 140.9, 469.20: written φᾰλαγγ-εῖον, EM 786.45.
stung by a venomous spider, Gal. 13.66.
soldier in a phalanx, Plb. 4.12.12, D.S. 18.2, D.H. 4.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: Gal. 12.150:—also fem. φᾰλαγγ-ῖτις, ιδος, ἡ, Dsc. 3.108.
armed like the phalanx, σπεῖρα Plb. 18.28.10.
fight in a phalanx; generally, fight in the ranks, opp. ἱππομ-, πυργομ-, X. Cyr. 6.4.18, cf. D.S. 19.30.
fighting in the φάλαγξ, AP 9.285 ( Phil.).
furnish with rollers, Polyaen. 5.2.6: τὰς προσαγωγὰς τοῖς μηχανήμασι Ph. Bel. 98.5.
roller, Phryn. PS p.124 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: a Dionysiac procession, Hsch.
relaxation or fall of the eyelid, Sever. ap. Aët. 7.68, Paul.Aeg. 6.8.
διστιχία or τριστιχία of the eyelashes, Ps.- Gal. 14.767,771.
block of wood, SIG 57.33 ( Milet., v B. C.).

line of battle, battle-array, Hom. only in Il., once in sg., Τρώων ῥῆξε φάλαγγα Il. 6.6: elsewh. pl. the ranks of an army in battle, Δαναοὶ ῥήξαντο φάλαγγας 11.90; φάλαγγες ἀνδρῶν 19.158, Hes. Th. 935; τῶν κάτω Διὸς φαλάγγων S. Ichn. (lyr.) in PTeb. 692 iii 10.

heavy infantry ( ὁπλῖται) in battle-order, X. An. 1.8.17, al.; ἡ φ. τῶν ὁπλιτῶν ib. 6.5.27, cf. D. 9.49; opp. πελτασταί, X. An. 6.5.25; opp. ἱππεῖς, Id. Cyr. 6.3.2, Ages. 2.9; τοὺς ἱππεῖς πρὸ τῆς φ. ἔστησαν D.S. 20.10, cf. Plu. Crass. 23; but οἱ Ἕλληνες ἱππεῖς ὥσπερ φ. ἐπὶ τεττάρων παρατεταγμένοι X. HG 3.4.13: esp. line of battle, opp. κέρας (column in marching order), ἐπὶ φάλαγγος ἄγειν, opp. κατὰ κέρας or ἐπὶ κέρως ἄγειν, Id. Cyr. 1.6.43; of ships, Id. HG 6.2.30; ἐκ κέρατος εἰς φ. καταστῆσαι to form from column into line, Id. Cyr. 8.5.15; παρʼ ἀσπίδα παραγαγόντας τὴν ἐνωμοτίαν ἐπὶ φάλαγγος Id. An. 4.3.26; ἐπὶ φάλαγγος καθίστασθαι Id. Cyr. 6.3.21, cf. An. 6.5.7, 25.

data.quote: τοὺς ἱππεῖς πρὸ τῆς φ. ἔστησαν
οἱ Ἕλληνες ἱππεῖς ὥσπερ φ. ἐπὶ τεττάρων παρατεταγμένοι
παρʼ ἀσπίδα παραγαγόντας τὴν ἐνωμοτίαν ἐπὶ φάλαγγος

children.label: b
children.definition: main body, centre, opp. the wings ( κέρατα), Id. Cyr. 7.1.6, al.

children.label: c
children.definition: camp, εἴσω, ἔξω φάλαγγος, Id. Ages. 2.15. Lac. 12.3, cf. Eq. 8.12.
phalanx, Plb. 18.29 sqq., etc.

children.label: a
children.definition: corps of 16384 ὁπλῖται, Ascl. Tact. 2.7, Ael. Tact. 8.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: corps of 8192 ψιλοί ( = ἐπίταγμα, q.v.) Ascl. Tact. 2.7, Arr. Tact. 14.2.

children.label: c
children.definition: contingent of 64 chariots ( = two κέρατα), Ascl. Tact. 8, Ael. Tact. 22.2.

children.label: d
children.definition: contingent of 64 elephants, ib. 23.
λοπάδων παρατεταγμένη φ. Diph. 44.3; of a band of pupils, Lib. Ep. 145.1; of a governorʼs staff (Lat. officium), Id. Or. 46.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: round piece of wood, trunk, log, φάλαγγες ἐβένου Hdt. 3.97; ἐκ κοτίνοιο φ. A.R. 2.843; φ. πύξιναι IG ΙΙ(2).287 B 145 ( Delos, iii B. C.).
rollers for moving heavy loads, A.R. 1.375 sq., Orph. A. 270: sg., Phryn. PS p.124B.
arm of a balance, Arist. Mech. 849b36; arm of the Danish steelyard, ib. 853b25.

children.label: IV
children.definition: bone between two joints of the fingers and toes, Arist. HA 493b29; pl., Ruf. Onom. 84 (but metacarpals, [ Ruf.] Oss. 22).
row of eyelashes, Paul.Aeg. 6.8.

children.label: V
children.definition: Ar. V. 1509, Ra. 1314 (lyr.), Pl.Com. 22, X. Mem. 3.11.6: masc. in Arist. HA 609a5. (The orig. sense was prob. log, cf. OHG. balcho ‘beam’, Lat. sufflamen (for sub-flag-men) ‘brake’.)
used by the poet Phalaecus, Anon.Metr. Oxy. 220 viii 8, Heph. 10.3, etc.
bald bare hill, St.Byz.:—hence freq. as a placename.
to be baldheaded, Suid. s.v. ἀωρόλειος.
rather bald, D.C. 76.8.
become bald, Hdt. 3.12, Arist. HA 518b26, GA 783b8:—later in Act., φαλακρώσουσι φαλακρώματα LXX Ez. 27.31 cod. A.

baldheaded, Anacr. 68, Hdt. 3.12, 4.23, Hp. Aph. 6.34, Pl. R. 495e, Sammelb. 4637.16 (ii B. C.), etc.; prop. bald on the crown, Arist. HA 518a27; φ. τὴν κεφαλήν Luc. Luct. 16; πρόσωπον φαλακρόν E. Cyc. 227; οἱ φαλακροί Ar. Nu. 540 (lyr.), Pax 767 (lyr.), etc.: prov. of labour in vain, φαλακρῷ κτένας δανείζειν Plu. Prov. 26; φαλακρὸν τίλλειν Suid.
like a bald head, blunt, knobbed, φ. σιδήρια of cauterizing irons, Hp. Art. 11; στρογγύλωσις ib. 61; φαλακρότερος (v.l. -ώτερος) εὐδίας Sophr. 108.
bald spot, ἔχειν φαλακρόν τινα Anon. Incred. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ φ. name of a fallacy, D.L. 2.108. [ φᾰλᾰκρός E. l.c., Ar. Nu. 540.]
baldness on the crown, opp. ἀναφαλαντίασις (in front), Arist. HA 518a28.

children.label: II
children.definition: smoothness, φ. κεφαλῆς of a bone, Hp. Mochl. 41.
bald head, used for a bald man, Cic. Att. 14.2.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: bald place, LXX Le. 13.42, al.: pl., ib. Ez. 27.31 cod. A.
a becoming bald, baldness, Plu. QConv. 2.652f (pl.), Aet. phys. 919c, Aq., Sm. Mi. 1.16, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.2, Sor. ap. Gal. 12.420 (pl.).

definition: φαλακτόνοιο εἶδος ἱέρακος, Hsch.; cf. φαβοκτόνος.
φαλάμεσσιν, written for παλάμαισιν in MAMA 1.382 (Phrygia, iv/v A.D.).
φαλάνθειος, ὁ, epith. of Hermes, IG 2(2).4855.

children.definition: bald in front, βρέγμα AP 9.317, cf. D.L. 7.160, Phryn. PS p.124 B. cod.; neut. φάλανθον, τό, bald patch, οὐλὴ φαλάνθῳ δεξιῷ PStrassb. 81.29 (ii B.C.).
bald man, Luc. Philops. 18.
bald place, v.l. in LXX Le. 13.43.

coot, Fulica atra, so called from its bald white head, Ar. Ach. 875, Av. 565 (anap., in Ion. form), Arist. HA 593b16 (v.l. φαληρίς), Fr. 350, Alex.Mynd. ap. Ath. 9.395e; φαληρίδες ταριχηραί Cleomenes ap.eund. 9.393c.

children.label: II
children.definition: canary grass, Phalaris nodosa, Dsc. 3.142 (both forms in codd.); phaleri (sic), Plin. HN 27.126.
tyranny, like that of Phalaris, Cic. Att. 7.12.2.
furnished with φάλαρα, name of Athena, Call. Fr. 503.
boss or disc, mostly in pl., once in Hom., βάλλετο δʼ αἰεὶ κὰπ φάλαρʼ εὐποίηθʼ, of metal bosses on a helmet, Il. 16.106; βασιλείου τιάρας φάλαρον πιφαύσκων A. Pers. 662 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: cheek-pieces of a horseʼs head-stall (expld. by παραγναθίδες Hsch., τὰ τῶν γνάθων σκεπάσματα Phot.), Hdt. 1.215, E. Supp. 586, X. HG 4.1.39, Ptol.Euerg. 9J.; but φάλαρα is a gloss in ἀμπυκτήρια φ. πώλων S. OC 1069 (lyr.); cf. Lat. phalerae.
bandages for the cheek, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.44, Sor. Fasc. 18.

children.label: III
children.definition: ornaments, Plu. Cupid. 2.528a, D.Chr. 78.26.

definition: φάλαρος [φᾰ], α, ον, (or φαλᾱρός, ά, όν Hsch.), Dor. for the Ion. φάληρος (v. infr. II),

children.definition: having a patch of white, ὁ κύων ὁ φάλαρος the dog with a white spot, Theoc. 8.27; ὁ Φάλαρος, as a ramʼs name, Id. 5.103.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὄρη χιόνεσσι φάληρα hills patched with snow, Nic. Th. 461. (Cf. φαλός, φαλακρός.)

definition: φαλεροῦχος ( φάλαρον, cf. Lat. phalera), ὁ,

children.definition: wearing φάλαρα, epith. of the Sun, PMag.Berol. 2.90.

to be patched with white, κύματα φαληριόωντα waves crested with white foam, Il. 13.799; φαληριῶσαν σπίλον white with breakers, Lyc. 188: φ. στόρθυγξ white with foam, Id. 491; λίθον λευκὰ φαληριόωντα App.Anth. 3.79 ( Posidipp.).

Phalerum, the western harbour of Athens, Hdt. 5.63, etc.: Φαληροῖ at Ph., X. Eq.Mag. 3.1, Plu. Thes. 17; Φαληρόθεν from Ph., Pl. Smp. 172a; Φαληρόνδε to Ph., Th. 1.107:— Φαληρεύς, έως, ὁ, a Phalerian, Hdt. 5.63, etc.; fem. Φαληρίς, ίδος, St.Byz.: Adj. Φαληρικός, ή, όν, Th. 2.13, Ar. Ach. 901, al.

definition: φαλῆς, ῆτος, or φάλης, ητος ( φάλεω Hippon. 14 Diehl), ὁ,

children.definition: S. Ichn. 145 (pl.), Ar. Lys. 771 (hex.), Theoc. Ep. 4.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Φᾰλῆς, ῆτος, ὁ, Phales, Φ. ἑταῖρε Βακχίου Ar. Ach. 263 (lyr.): also written Φάλης, ητος (which acc. to Sch. Ar. l.c. was the Dor. form), Sophr. 39, Luc. JTr. 42.

definition: φαλίζει θέλει, Hsch. φαλικρόν· ἄκρατον, Id. (cf. χαλ-).
φαλιόπους, ὁ, ἡ, neut. πουν, gen. ποδος,

children.definition: white-footed, Hsch.
Call. Fr. 176, PPetr. 2pp. 115,117 (iii B. C.), Procop. Goth. 1.18.

definition: φαλίπτει μωραίνει, Hsch. φαλίσσομαι, ( φαλός) Pass.,

children.definition: to be white, Id. φάλκη, ἡ, bat, Id.; also = ὁ τῆς κόμης αὐχμός, Id.

definition: φάλκης, ου, ὁ, part of a ship,

children.definition: rib, acc. to Poll. 1.85, 86 τὸ τῇ στείρᾳ προσηλούμενον. (Cf. ἐμφαλκόομαι.)
the minimum share of an estate which must be left to the heirs under the Lex Falcidia, PMasp. 97v71 (vi A. D.), al.
platform or wagon used in the φαλληφόρια, IG 11(2).144 A 34, al. ( Delos, iv B. C.).
Corn. ND 30.
carrying of the phallus, IG 2(2).673b7.

whale, A. Dict. in PSI 11.1209.9, Arist. HA 489b4, 521b24, 537a31, al., Str. 3.2.7, Ael. NA 9.50, 16.18, Philostr. VA 2.14, Nonn. D. 6.298, Babr. 39.1, Gal. 6.728,737, UP 3.12, al., Porph. Abst. 3.20.
any devouring monster, Ar. V. 35, 39, Lyc. 841.

children.label: II
children.definition: moth, Nic. Th. 760 (Rhodian in this sense acc. to Sch.).—In late codd. (as those of Gal.) freq. written φάλαινα; but cod.Rav. of Ar., and the best codd. of Arist., Str., Babr., Lyc., Nic., Philostr., and Nonn. (the Pap. of A. Dict. is indistinct) have φάλλ-; cf. sq. [φάλλη]; the metre requires a long first syll. in Babr., Nic., Nonn., and admits it elsewhere; in Lat. the best spelling is ballaena.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg. II, Hsch.

definition: Φαλλήν, ῆνος, ὁ, ( φαλλός) a name of Dionysus, Paus. 10.19.3 ( κεφαλῆνα codd., corr. Lobeck); cf. Φαλῆς:— Adj. φαλληνός, όν, φαλληνὸν τιμῶσι Διωνύσοιο κάρηνον Orac. ap. Eus. PE 5.36 (s. v. l., φαληνοτιμῶσι cod.A, Φαλλῆνος τιμῶσι Lobeck).

children.definition: carry a phallus in procession, Plu. Isid. 2.365c.
festival of Dionysus in which a phallus was carried in procession, Plu. Isid. 2.355e.
of or for the φαλλός: τὸ φ. (sc. μέλος) the phallic song, Ar. Ach. 261, Arist. Po. 1449a11; restd. in IG 1(2).187.33; also a dance, Poll. 4.100.
one who mounts on a phallus-shaped pillar, phallic priest, Luc. Syr.D. 29.
membrum virile, phallus, or a figure thereof, borne in procession in the cult of Dionysus as an emblem of the generative power in nature, IG 1(2).45.13, Hdt. 2.48, 49, Ar. Ach. 243, Luc. Syr.D. 16.
Philomnest. 2.
bearing a phallus, Semus 20; fem. in AJA 37.252 ( Latium, ii A. D.).
white, Hsch. (Cf. Skt. bhālam ‘brightness, forehead’, Welsh bal ‘having a white spot on the forehead’, etc.)

children.label: II
children.definition: stammering, deaf, stupid, Id. (Cf. φαλίπτει and perh. Old Slav. zǔlǔ ‘wicked’, Skt. hvárate ‘to be crooked’, etc.)
horn of a helmet, Il. 3.362, 4.459, 13.132, 614, 16.216, 338; cf. ἀμφίφαλος, τρυφάλεια. (Expld. as a boss or ornament by Gramm., Apollon. Lex., etc.)

definition: φαλύγματα ὑγράσματα, Hsch. φαλύνει· λαμπρύνει, Id.

children.definition: SIG 56.9 ( Argos, v B. C.).

definition: φαλύσσεται καταρρήσσει, περιέρχεται, Hsch. φαλωθείς (i.e. Dor. for φηλ-, unless φᾰλ-) · παρατραπείς, Id.

children.definition: furnished with φάλοι, περικεφαλαῖαι Eust. 425.44.
= Lat. familia, BCH 14.370 ( Caria), Gp. 2.7.2; φ. μονομάχων Inscr.Cos 141.1, IGRom. 4.1454 ( Smyrna); στρατιωτῶν BGU 316.10 (iv A. D.).

definition: φαμιλιαρικός, ή, όν, = sq., Edict.Diocl. 26.31; also φαμελ- ib. 10, al.; φαμηλ- MAMA 3.100 ( Diocaesarea).

children.definition: = Lat. familiaris, Edict.Diocl. 26.96,117, PStrassb. 40.11, 24 (vi A. D.); also φαμελ- Edict.Diocl. 26.75, al.

definition: φαμιλιαρίς, ίδος, ἡ, = fem. of foreg., ib. 28.43,53.
φαμιστός, ά, όν, Dor. for *φημιστός (which is not found),

children.definition: famous, Bull.Soc.Alex. 7.245 ( i B. C. /i A. D.).

definition: φαμμάστρια τὰ ψαιστά, καὶ ἑορτή τις, Hsch. φάμμη· ἄλφιτα, Id.
φάν, poet. for ἔφασαν, v. φημί.
φάναι [ᾰ], inf. of φημί; but φᾶναι, inf. aor. of φαίνω.

children.definition: giving or bringing light, of Zeus, E. Rh. 355 (lyr.); of Apollo, in Chios, Achae. 35.
lanterna, prob. an error for φανός, Gloss.
lamplighter, Stud.Pal. 10.251 A2 (vi A. D.), etc.

definition: φανάριον, τό, Dim. of φανός, Eust. 1571.4, Sch. Opp. H. 5.430.

children.definition: Hsch.
openly, Hdn.Gr. 1.509.
Nicom. Harm. 4.
openly hating, opp. φανερόφιλος, Arist. EN 1124b26.
explain, reveal, Heph.Astr. 3.37 ( Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(3).85); τὰ πράγματα Sch. Ar. Eq. 1253, PLond. 5.1708.70, 1729.40 (vi A. D.).
illustration, explanation, Gloss.

definition: φανερός, ά, όν, but ός, όν, E. Ba. 991 (lyr.): ( φαίνω):—

children.definition: visible, manifest, ἡ στήλη ἔχει πάντα φ., i.e. all that is in it can be plainly seen, Hdt. 3.24; φ. ὄμμασιν ἐμοῖς E. Ba. 501; φ. τι δεῖξαι S. Tr. 608 (v.l.); θήσω φανέρʼ ἀθρόʼ Pi. O. 13.98; φ. ποιῆσαι Pl. Lg. 630b, etc.; ἐς φ. ὄψιν βαίνειν E. El. 1236 (anap.); τοὔργον παρέσται φ. S. Ph. 1291; φ. χαρακτὴρ ἀρετᾶς E. HF 658 (lyr.); φ. πηγαί Th. 2.15; ἐσβολαὶ ἐς Αἴγυπτον Hdt. 3.5; φ. ἔχθραν κτήσασθαι Th. 1.42; διαφορὰ φ. ἐγένετο ib. 102; φ. θάνατος, ὄλεθρος, opp. ἀφανής, Antipho 3.3.7, And. 1.53; φ. ὑποψία εἰς ἐμὲ ἰοῦσα Antipho 2.2.6; φ. γενόμενος if detected, Lys. 7.12:— Constr.: φανερός εἰμι c. part., ἀπικόμενοι φανεροί εἰσι they are known to have come, Hdt. 3.26; ἐπισπεύδων φανερὸς ἦν Id. 7.18; ὁ μέν ἐστι φ. ἐκβὰς ἐκ τοῦ πλοίου καὶ οὐκ εἰσβὰς πάλιν Antipho 5.23: folld. by Conj., φανεροὶ γιγνόμενοι ὅτι ποιοῦσιν X. Cyr. 2.2.12; φ. ἦν ὅπως ἐγίγνωσκεν Id. Mem. 1.1.17: impers., φανερόν [ἐστιν] ὅτι . . ib. 3.9.2; εἰ φανερὸν γίγνοιτο ὅτι . . Pl. Phd. 70d.

data.quote: ὁ μέν ἐστι φ. ἐκβὰς ἐκ τοῦ πλοίου καὶ οὐκ εἰσβὰς πάλιν

children.definition: shining, illustrious, προεδρίη Xenoph. 2.7; ὁδός Pi. O. 6.73; conspicuous, remarkable, φ. μηδὲν κατεργάζεσθαι Th. 1.17.
φ. οὐσία real property, opp. personalty ( ἀφανής), Lys. 32.4, Fr. 79, D. 50.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: in possession (opp. in action), And. 1.118, Is. 6.30, D. 38.7.

children.label: c
children.definition: in hand, in cash, μηδὲν φανερὸν κεκτῆσθαι to have no cash in hand, Din. 1.70; λαβὼν ἀργύριον φ. καὶ ὁμολογούμενον D. 56.1; πόρος φ. Id. 14.24; φ. οὐσία Id. 27.57; φ. χρήματα Lys. 12.83; φ. ποιεῖν D. 28.4; φανερόν τι a certain sum of money, Sch. Ar. Pl. 330, Sch. Aeschin. 1.102.
φ. ψήφῳ by open vote, opp. κρύβδην (ballot), D. 43.82, cf. Arist. Ath. 68.2; ψῆφον φ. διενεγκεῖν Th. 4.74; τὴν ψῆφον φ. φέρειν Pl. Lg. 767d; φ. ἡ ψῆφος τιθεμένη ib. 855d.

Adv. -ρῶς openly, manifestly, βουλόμενος φ. Hdt. 9.71; στείχειν A. Pr. 1090 (anap.); οἴχεσθαι S. El. 833 (lyr.); ἀκοῦσαι Ar. Nu. 291 (anap.); ἀποδείκνυσθαι τὴν γνώμην Th. 1.87; φ. ἐρᾶν, opp. λάθρᾳ, Pl. Smp. 182d; τὸ φ. ἐξεῖναι Isoc. 2.3: Comp., φανερώτερον ἐκπολεμεῖν Th. 6.91; -τέρως Arist. PA 657a2: but,

children.label: b
children.definition: τὸ φ. freq. with Preps. in advb. sense, ἐκ τοῦ φ. openly, Hdt. 5.96, 8.126; πολέμιος οὐκ ὢν ἐκ τοῦ φ. not openly declared, Th. 4.79; ἐκ τοῦ φ. τὴν μάχην ποιεῖσθαι X. HG 6.5.16; ἐκ τοῦ φ. ἀποφεύγειν Id. Mem. 3.11.8; ἀπὸ τοῦ φ. D.H. 4.4; also ἐν τῷ φ. σαυτὸν παρεῖχες X. Cyr. 7.5.55; ἀκοῦσαι ἐν τῷ φ. Id. An. 1.3.21; βουλεύεσθαι D. 18.235 (rarely ἐν φ. X. Ages. 5.7); ἐς τὸ φ. ἀποδῦναι Th. 1.6; αἱ ἐς τὸ φ. λεγόμεναι αἰτίαι, Id. 1.23; τὸν σῖτον φέρειν ἐς τὸ φ. into public, Id. 3.27, cf. Pl. Grg. 480c, etc.; εἰπεῖν κατὰ τὸ φ. Ar. Th. 525 (lyr.); ἐπὶ φανεροῖς ξυνελθεῖν on public, acknowledged terms, Th. 1.69.

data.quote: ἐκ τοῦ φ. τὴν μάχην ποιεῖσθαι

children.definition: manifest, conspicuous, εἰ [Διόνυσος καὶ Πὰν] φ. ἐγένοντο ἐν τῇ Ἑλλάδι Hdt. 2.146; φανερὰ . . ἦλθε κόρα S. OT 507 (lyr.); Κύπρις . . φανερὰ τῶνδʼ ἐφάνη πράκτωρ Id. Tr. 861 (lyr.); πάντων -ώτατος Βρασίδας ἐγένετο Th. 4.11, cf. X. Cyr. 7.5.58; οἱ -ώτεροι persons of distinction, Philostr. VA 2.20.

data.quote: εἰ [Διόνυσος καὶ Πὰν] φ. ἐγένοντο ἐν τῇ Ἑλλάδι

children.definition: open, frank, opp. ἐπίβουλος, Arist. EN 1149b15.

display, show, Ph. ap. Eus. PE 8.14.
open friend, opp. φανερομισής, Arist. EN 1124b27.

make manifest, σεαυτὸν τῷ κόσμῳ Ev.Jo. 7.4, cf. 2.11, 2 Ep.Cor. 5.10 ( Pass.); reveal, make clear, τινὶ τὴν ἀλήθειαν POxy. 925.4 (v A. D.); ἀληθῆ πεφανέρωται have been demonstrated, Olymp. Alch.p.88 B.

children.label: II

one who makes manifest, τῶν ἀποκεκρυμμένων PMag.Leid.V. 7.12 (pl.).

love of show and ostentation, Eust. 894.8, 904.62.

Cyn. 10.7; τὸ φ. brightness, light, ib. 5.18; στρέφειν πρὸς τὸ φ. ἐκ τοῦ σκοτώδους Pl. R. 518c, cf. 478c ( Comp.); φανά τε καὶ καλά ib. 506d, cf. Phld. Po. 2.45; φανότατος ἀήρ Gal. 18(2).285; τοῖς φανοτάτοις θεῶν Ἡλίῳ καὶ Σελήνῃ Hld. 10.4.

Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.4, Suid. s.v. ἐπιτολῆς.
